definition: to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)

sentences.english: Although sell mutually and generally, also compromise.
sentences.chinese: 虽然卖相一般，但也将就了。

sentences.english: Cake cooked by myself, it looks not too bad.
sentences.chinese: 自己烤制的蛋糕，卖相还不错哦。

sentences.english: Marched to the city of fish store shop, all kinds of seafood presentation but person.
sentences.chinese: 成行成市的鱼商店铺，各类海产品卖相可人。

sentences.english: This man-eating monster was found in Guangzhou. I think it's good for portrait.
sentences.chinese: 广州花都吃人湖怪，卖相倒是蛮好的，很适合拍肖像。

sentences.english: Beautiful lawyers get paid more than the( T)ir less attractive 2)colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 漂亮的律师赚的钱比卖相较差的同事多。

sentences.english: Although sell mutually and generally, also concession.
sentences.chinese: 虽然卖相一般，但也将就了。

sentences.english: I also bought fishball that looks tempting.
sentences.chinese: 我也买了卖相不错的鱼丸。

sentences.english: The legs and wings should be stuffed into the body for better look.
sentences.chinese: 想卖相更好看，必须把脚和翼均塞入鸭体内。

sentences.english: Beautiful lawyers get paid more than their less attractive 2)colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 漂亮的律师赚的钱比卖相较差的同事多。

definition: to arrange food on a plate/to plate up/food presentation/(watchmaking) balance wheel
to smell, look and taste great
taste/texture (of food)/how food feels in the mouth
dish/lean and hungry look (resulting from vegetarian diet)/emaciated look (from malnutrition)
to be fond of eating/to be gluttonous
not up to much/very indifferent/nothing great about it/nothing good to be said about it
